title: I05-4010

sentences.text: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy .
Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail .
The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws .
It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research .
This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents recent research on the harvesting and alignment of English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web, detailing methodologies and resulting in a bilingual corpus valuable for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-text_collection.label: text collection
Entity-text_collection.description: A text collection that refers to a bilingual corpus of English and Chinese legal texts from Hong Kong, comprising 10.4 million English words and 18.3 million Chinese characters, specifically aligned to the subparagraph level for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-the_resultant_bilingual_corpus.label: the resultant bilingual corpus
Entity-the_resultant_bilingual_corpus.description: The resultant bilingual corpus refers to a comprehensive collection of English and Chinese legal texts, specifically 10.4 million English words and 18.3 million Chinese characters, derived from the laws of Hong Kong, which serves as a valuable resource for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-18.3_m_chinese_character.label: 18.3 M Chinese characters
Entity-18.3_m_chinese_character.description: The mention '18.3 M Chinese characters' refers to the total count of Chinese characters in a bilingual corpus that includes legal texts from Hong Kong, which is used for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-our_recent_work.label: our recent work
Entity-our_recent_work.description: The term 'our recent work' refers to the research focused on harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong's laws from the Web, resulting in a bilingual corpus that supports empirical machine translation research.

Entity-10.4_m_english_word.label: 10.4 M English words
Entity-10.4_m_english_word.description: 10.4 M English words refers to the total word count of an authoritative bilingual corpus created from English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong.

Entity-exploring_and_harvesting_english-.label: exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts
Entity-exploring_and_harvesting_english-.description: The phrase 'exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts' refers to the research activity focused on collecting and aligning bilingual text data from the Web, specifically targeting English and Chinese legal documents, to create a comprehensive corpus for empirical machine translation studies.

Entity-basic_methodology_and_practical_t.label: Basic methodology and practical techniques
Entity-basic_methodology_and_practical_t.description: The phrase 'Basic methodology and practical techniques' refers to the systematic approaches and specific methods employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web.

Entity-technique.label: techniques
Entity-technique.description: The term 'techniques' refers to the practical methods and approaches employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-practical_technique.label: practical techniques
Entity-practical_technique.description: Practical techniques refer to the specific methods and approaches employed in the paper to effectively harvest and align English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web.

Entity-basic_methodology.label: Basic methodology
Entity-basic_methodology.description: Basic methodology refers to the foundational approaches and practical techniques employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web.

Entity-subparagraph_level.label: subparagraph level
Entity-subparagraph_level.description: The 'subparagraph level' refers to a specific tier within the legal text hierarchy that allows for detailed alignment and organization of legal documents, particularly in the context of English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-english-chinese_bitexts.label: English-Chinese bitexts
Entity-english-chinese_bitexts.description: English-Chinese bitexts are bilingual texts that consist of parallel translations of content in English and Chinese, often used as language resources for translation studies and linguistic research.

Entity-a_larger_volume_from_the_web.label: a larger volume from the Web
aliases: a larger volume from the Web
Entity-a_larger_volume_from_the_web.description: a larger volume from the Web refers to the potential for collecting and processing a more extensive set of English-Chinese bilingual texts, specifically legal documents, beyond the initial corpus created in the study.

mentions.local_name: a larger volume from the Web

Entity-larger_volume.label: larger volume
Entity-larger_volume.description: The term 'larger volume' refers to an increased quantity of English-Chinese bitexts that can be harvested from the Web, building upon the foundational work presented in the paper.

Entity-hk_law.label: HK laws
Entity-hk_law.description: HK laws refer to the legal regulations and statutes that govern the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, encompassing both local and national laws applicable within its jurisdiction.

Entity-web.label: Web
Entity-web.description: The 'Web' refers to the global system of interconnected computer networks that is used to access and share information, specifically in the context of harvesting English-Chinese legal texts from online sources.

Entity-the_numbering_system_in_the_legal.label: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy
aliases: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy
Entity-the_numbering_system_in_the_legal.description: The numbering system in the legal text hierarchy refers to the structured method used to organize and reference legal documents and their components, such as laws and regulations, in a systematic way that facilitates the alignment and retrieval of bilingual legal texts.

mentions.local_name: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy

Entity-legal_text_hierarchy.label: legal text hierarchy
Entity-legal_text_hierarchy.description: The legal text hierarchy refers to the structured organization of legal documents, specifically the numbering system used to categorize and align laws and regulations, which facilitates the extraction and comparison of legal texts across different languages.

Entity-bilingual_corpus.label: bilingual corpus
Entity-bilingual_corpus.description: A bilingual corpus is a collection of texts in two languages that is used for linguistic research, translation studies, and language learning, often containing parallel texts or aligned sentences for comparative analysis.

Entity-chinese_character.label: Chinese characters
Entity-chinese_character.description: Chinese characters are logograms used in the writing of the Chinese language, representing words or morphemes and forming a key component of East Asian writing systems.

Entity-hong_kong.label: Hong Kong
Entity-hong_kong.description: Hong Kong is a Special Administrative Region of China located on the southern coast of the country, known for its vibrant economy, rich cultural heritage, and significant global financial center.

Entity-empirical_mt_research.label: empirical MT research
Entity-empirical_mt_research.description: Empirical MT research refers to the systematic investigation and analysis of machine translation methods and systems through the collection and evaluation of real-world data and user feedback.

Entity-numbering_system.label: numbering system
Entity-numbering_system.description: A numbering system is an organizational framework used to categorize and structure information, often in legal or formal documents, by assigning numerical identifiers to sections, paragraphs, or items.

Entity-english_word.label: English words
Entity-english_word.description: English words are the individual units of language used in the English language, consisting of letters and forming the basis of written and spoken communication.

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to 'Machine Translation', which is a field of research focused on the automatic translation of text from one language to another.

Entity-methodology.label: methodology
Entity-methodology.description: Methodology refers to a systematic framework or set of principles that guide the selection and application of research methods and approaches in a study.

summary: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy . Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail . The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws . It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research . This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or making known the object to an audience. It implies a formal or structured communication of information, findings, or ideas, where the subject serves as the medium through which the object is conveyed.

Predicate-harvests.label: harvests
Predicate-harvests.description: The predicate 'harvests' indicates an action where the subject actively gathers, collects, or extracts a specific type of resource or information represented by the object. In this context, it implies that the subject is engaged in a process of obtaining or compiling the object, which can be data, materials, or any other form of content, suggesting a productive or beneficial outcome from the interaction.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' indicates a relationship of belonging or association between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject is related to, derived from, or characterized by the object, often implying that the subject contains elements or aspects that pertain to the object.

Predicate-from.label: from
Predicate-from.description: The predicate 'from' indicates a source or origin relationship between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject is derived, obtained, or originates from the object, establishing a directional flow of information, material, or influence from the object to the subject.

Predicate-via_utilizing.label: via utilizing
Predicate-via_utilizing.description: The predicate 'via utilizing' indicates a method or means by which the subject engages with or applies the object. It suggests that the subject employs the object as a tool or resource to achieve a specific purpose or outcome, thereby establishing a functional relationship between the two elements.

Predicate-is_utilized_in.label: is utilized in
Predicate-is_utilized_in.description: The predicate 'is utilized in' indicates that the subject serves a functional role or purpose within the context of the object. It implies that the subject is actively employed or applied in the processes, structures, or systems represented by the object, highlighting a relationship of practical use or application.

Predicate-are_reported_in_detail.label: are reported in detail
Predicate-are_reported_in_detail.description: The predicate 'are reported in detail' indicates that the subject provides a comprehensive and thorough account or description of the object. It suggests that the information conveyed about the object is extensive, covering various aspects and nuances, thereby enhancing the understanding of the object in question.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates that the subject is composed of or includes the object as a part of its entirety. It establishes a relationship where the subject holds or possesses the object within its scope, suggesting that the object is an integral component or element of the subject.

Predicate-laid_a_foundation_for.label: laid a foundation for
Predicate-laid_a_foundation_for.description: The predicate 'laid a foundation for' indicates that the subject has established a basis or groundwork that enables or supports the development, exploration, or implementation of the object. It suggests that the subject's contributions or findings are essential for the subsequent activities or studies represented by the object.

Predicate-is_valuable_to.label: is valuable to
Predicate-is_valuable_to.description: The predicate 'is valuable to' establishes a relationship where the subject is recognized as having significant importance, usefulness, or benefit to the object. This indicates that the subject contributes positively to the objectives, goals, or needs of the object, suggesting that the object derives some form of advantage or enhancement from the subject.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider range of concepts or items, of which the subject is a part, thereby facilitating a classification or categorization of knowledge.
